name: UsePythonVersion
description: Use the specified version of Python from the tool cache, optionally adding it to the PATH
helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=871498) or [see the Python documentation](https://www.python.org/doc/)
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: Version spec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version range or exact version of a Python version to use, using semver's version range syntax. [More information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=2006180)

inputs.name: disableDownloadFromRegistry
inputs.label: Disable downloading releases from the GitHub registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to disable downloading missing python version from the [Github Actions registry](https://github.com/actions/python-versions). Check this if you only want to use local pre-installed python.

inputs.name: allowUnstable
inputs.label: Allow downloading unstable releases
inputs.helpMarkDown: Allow downloading unstable python versions from [Github Actions python versions registry](https://github.com/actions/python-versions).

inputs.name: githubToken
inputs.label: GitHub token for GitHub Actions python registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: GitHub token is needed to prevent anonymous requests limit to the [Github Actions python versions registry](https://github.com/actions/python-versions). Leaving this empty may cause download failures. Not needed if you only use locally installed python.

inputs.name: addToPath
inputs.label: Add to PATH
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to prepend the retrieved Python version to the PATH environment variable to make it available in subsequent tasks or scripts without using the output variable.

inputs.name: architecture
inputs.label: Architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: The target architecture (x86, x64) of the Python interpreter.

outputVariables.name: pythonLocation
outputVariables.description: The directory of the installed Python distribution. Use this in subsequent tasks to access this installation of Python.

messages.ToolNotFoundSelfHosted: If this is a self-hosted agent, see how to configure side-by-side %s versions at %s.
messages.VersionNotFound: Version spec %s for architecture %s did not match any version in Agent.ToolsDirectory.
